channel.title: Singleton or Static Methods

item.title: Singleton or Static Methods
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

static methods would be faster but singletons would provide a lot more flexibility in terms of actually having a reference to an object to play with, instead of just encapsulating a bunch of methods. personally i’d avoid both unless they’re completely necessary, singletons are considered by many to be an anti-pattern and static methods are just yuck.

Read full topic

I dislike static methods. I really don’t know why.
Static is probably better though.

JavaWorld

How to navigate the deceptively simple Singleton pattern

The Singleton pattern is deceptively simple, even and especially for Java developers. In this classic JavaWorld article, David Geary demonstrates how Java developers implement singletons, with code examples for multithreading, classloaders, and...

static class will be faster

item.title: Singleton or Static Methods
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Just a question on which one, using a singleton, or static methods, is better/more efficient.

Singleton:

public final class Singleton {
    private static final Singleton INSTANCE_ = new Singleton();

    private Singleton() {
        // Ensure one instance
    }

    public static Singleton getInstance() {
        return INSTANCE_;
    }

    public void someMethod() {
        // ...
    }
}
public final class Static {
    private Static() {
        // Ensure one instance
    }

    public static void someMethod() {
        // ...
    }
}

Is there some reason to use one over the other, or is it just personal preference?

Read full topic
